channel.title: Compiler and my JDK source
channel.description:
Iv'e just downloaded a new version of JDK for my server.
On my server compiler it says:
@echo off Title Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause
And my newly downloaded JDK name is:
jdk-6u14-windows-i586
How do I add my new jdk version to my compiler? Is there a .java code? Because now my compiler says "System cannot find the path specified" When I'm trying to compile my no-ip to the server. Someone please help!
Best regards, Lord Typhis

item.title: Compiler and my JDK source
item.dc:creator: @Lord_Typhis Lord Typhis
item.description:
@Lord_Typhis wrote:

Another issue: I put the _14 instead of the _20 on both sides, the client side and the server side, I pressed compile and this iswhat it said:

Note: client.java uses unchecked or unsafe operations.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.
Press any key to continue…

Then I tried to run my client and source and it says error, help!

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler and my JDK source
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Then you should be fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler and my JDK source
item.dc:creator: @Lord_Typhis Lord Typhis
item.description:
@Lord_Typhis wrote:

I must ask, do I put this code client sided or server sided?

Because on my server side it says:

echo off
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin\javac.exe” -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event*.java src\server\model\items*.java src\server\model\minigames*.java src\server\model\npcs*.java src\server\model\objects*.java src\server\model\players*.java src\server\model\players\skills*.java src\server\model\players\packets*.java src\server\model\shops*.java src\server\net*.java src\server\task*.java src\server\util*.java src\server\world*.java src\server\util\log*.java src\server*.java src\server\world\map*.java
pause

And I changed the _20 to _14

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler and my JDK source
item.dc:creator: @wurz1l wurz1l
item.description:
@wurz1l wrote:

@echo off Title Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler and my JDK source
item.dc:creator: @dragonman2 dragonman2
item.description:
@dragonman2 wrote:

Use this

@echo off
@TITLE Status Rs
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You Havent Downloaded Java
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler and my JDK source
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

That jdk version is 7 versions old. change the 20 in the compiling code to a 14.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler and my JDK source
item.dc:creator: @Lord_Typhis Lord Typhis
item.description:
@Lord_Typhis wrote:

Iv’e just downloaded a new version of JDK for my server.

On my server compiler it says:

@echo off
Title Compiler
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin\javac.exe” *.java
pause

And my newly downloaded JDK name is:

jdk-6u14-windows-i586

How do I add my new jdk version to my compiler? Is there a .java code? Because now my compiler says “System cannot find the path specified” When I’m trying to compile my no-ip to the server. Someone please help!

Best regards,
Lord Typhis
